main.name: Juan Pablo Mantilla
main.description: Hello! I'm Juan Pablo, Biomedical Engineer turned Programmer.
bio: I have 4 years of experience working mostly in data science, image processing and machine learning.
Lately I've been very interested in web development, diving into both backend and frontend development
main.contactmessage: If you want to get in touch with me, send me an email at jpmanti@gmail.com, I'd be happy to answer your questions.

description: Excelled in Modeling of biological systems, Innovation and  Creativity in Organizations coursework.
Dissertation: “Modeling and Control of Anesthetic Drug Effects on Physiological Signals Using Neural Networks.” Advisor: Dr. Pedro Gambús

education.degree: Master's Degree in Innovation and Entrepreneurship in Biomedical Engineering
description: Excelled in Machine learning, Financial management of biomedical firms, Microeconomic Foundations of Competitiveness , Management of Innovation and Entrepreneurship  coursework

work.title: Freelance IT
description: Created an automatic page navigation system based on Microsoft Edge Read Aloud.
Developed and maintained Backend and Frontend for web game using Django and ReactJS.

work.title: R&D Engineer
description: Defined and standardized protocol to extract and pre-process data from 10 years worth of patients records.
Implemented several Artificial Neural Networks to predict sedation effect of anesthetic drugs and control doses in real time.
Data collection inside ORs, following OR and clean room procedures

not_tech.name: Medical Image Processing (MRI, CT, PET, etc.)
Clean Room and Operating Room protocols

projects.title: KlotskiBlocks (beta)
projects.category: Game based on the famous Klotski Puzzle. Get GG block to right place to win.

projects.title: AHK media conntrol and productivity tools
projects.category: Auto Hot Key sctipts to increase prouctivity and media control.

projects.title: Morpheus
projects.category: Device to detect sleep phase and setup alarm for out of REM sleep timimg.

achievements.text: Awarded “The Best solution developed to address the needs of a Health Information System based on continuity of care” in the Medical Informatics and Telemedicine course.
First place in the Autonomous Regions phase of the XXV Olimpiada Española de Biología.
Reached the national phase of the Olimpiada Colombiana de Matemáticas 2012, 2013 and 2014.
Completed “Biomedical Engineering: Analysis, Computing and   Applications” seminars by CEEIBIS 2016.
Excellence Award for outstanding role in HISPAMUN Model UN.
